text.author: Bruno Grossi, José Iriarte-Díaz, Omar Larach, Mauricio Canals, Rodrigo A. Vásquez
text.title: Walking Like Dinosaurs: Chickens with Artificial Tails Provide Clues about Non-Avian Theropod Locomotion
text.summary: This discussion summarizes the results of an experiment in which an artificial tail was affixed to birds' bodies in order to study possible ways in which bipedal non-avian dinosaurs may have walked, finding that the location of the CoM may be a key factor in defining limb posture and kinematics.
